instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT? PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the backlight on the LCD screen, this is necessary to get the screen to light up..
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No backlight. <SIGNAL>PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> 24v and slowly drops
threads.message: Have another board with no backlight. Once turned on, the backlight flickers on and then off. <SIGNAL>PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> starts at about 24v and slowly drops to about 17v. With J9500 cable unplugged i get backlight. So replaced both the cable and the io board with the same result. I've checked for corrosion and found none. Also, the charge light isn't coming on with both io boards used.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No backlight. <SIGNAL>PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> 24v and slowly drops
threads.message:
Also,

<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> - 1.4v on <RESISTOR>R5171</RESISTOR>/1 and 3.4 on pad2. i Replaced the resistor and also check for shorts. Still reading the same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No backlight. <SIGNAL>PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> 24v and slowly drops
threads.message: Check again, disconnecting LIO flex and trackpad.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No backlight. <SIGNAL>PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> 24v and slowly drops
threads.message: Yep confirmed. Also, with LIO flex unplugged, <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is back to 3.4v and 1.4v with it unplugged.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No backlight. <SIGNAL>PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> 24v and slowly drops
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is back to 3.4v and 1.4v with it unplugged"
Should I read "plugged" instead???

If yes, then you have a problem with Hall sensor on the LIO board.
Usually corrosion on trace, or resistor; sometime on the LIO flex/connector.

Do you get image/backlight without LIO flex connected?
When <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> stays high...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No backlight. <SIGNAL>PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> 24v and slowly drops
threads.message:
Sorry, yeah meant 1.4v when LIO is plugged in.

I thought it was the LIO board, but i tried 3 different LIO boards and all 3 LIO boards are doing the same thing on this board and work just fine on known good board. 

Yes, i get image and backlight without the LIO flex connected and the <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> also is 3.4v at this point as well. 

I also just noticed the <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> is reading 1.4v both with the LIO flex connected and unconnected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No backlight. <SIGNAL>PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> 24v and slowly drops
threads.message:
Check LIO connector (J9500) for corrosion.
Also try another LIO flex.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No backlight. <SIGNAL>PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> 24v and slowly drops
threads.message: So decided to look closely again at the LIO flex, and sure enough pins 21 and 23 on J9500 were corroded. Replaced connector and that fixed it. Thanks once again for the assist.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No backlight. <SIGNAL>PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> 24v and slowly drops
